args.natural_language_statement: In any Hausdorff space, every compact set is closed.

retrieved_examples.nl: The image of a compact set under a continuous map is compact.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem compact_image_of_continuous {α β : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [TopologicalSpace β] {f : α → β} (hf : Continuous f) {s : Set α} (hs : IsCompact s) : IsCompact (f '' s) := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: A continuous bijection from a compact space to a Hausdorff space is a homeomorphism.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem continuous_bijective_of_compact_to_hausdorff_is_homeomorphism {α β : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [TopologicalSpace β] {f : α → β} (hf : Continuous f) (hf' : Function.Bijective f) (hcompact : IsCompact (univ : Set α)) (hhaus : T2Space β) : Homeomorph f := by sorry

import Mathlib
open Filter Set TopologicalSpace
open scoped Topology

/-- In any Hausdorff space, every compact set is closed. -/
theorem isClosed_of_isCompact {α : Type u_1} [TopologicalSpace α] [T2Space α] {s : Set α} (hs : IsCompact s) :
    IsClosed s := by sorry"}

import Mathlib
open Filter Set TopologicalSpace
open scoped Topology

/-- In any Hausdorff space, every compact set is closed. -/
theorem isClosed_of_isCompact {α : Type u_1} [TopologicalSpace α] [T2Space α] {s : Set α} (hs : IsCompact s) :
    IsClosed s := by sorry
